summary: 15 Movies In 2019
title: 15 Movies In 2019
body:
15 Movies In 2019

2018 was a really hard year for me for many different reasons that I’ll get into later this month, in my end of year reflection post. Needless to say, I’m really looking forward to 2019! Out with the old, in with the new! Here are a list of 15 movies that are coming out next year that I’m excited to see.

  1. Avengers 4
  2. The Lion King (live action remake)
  3. Dumbo (live action remake)
  4. Star Wars Episode 9

View On WordPress

blog.name: thefeministherald
blog.title: The Feminist Herald
blog.description: Brief Feminist Updates.  Feminism: Supporting the fight against the oppression of women through activism and the interrogation of the tools used to create and perpetuate a social system that oppresses women in order to afford privilege to men, especially white men. Tools like misogynistic narratives, ideas and attitudes and their use in politics, the media, education and all other social institutions and constructs. In addition, examining and pointing out how racism, homophobia and other oppressive systems and forms of discrimination intersect with misogynistic ideas creating hybrid attitudes, narratives and ideas against women of color, LGBT women, women with disabilities and other women who face those forms of discrimination.

blog.name: rampantmuses
blog.title: Hey Nonny, Nonny!
blog.description:
“Sigh no more, ladies, sigh no more, Men were deceivers ever, One foot in sea, and one on shore,To one thing constant never. Then sigh not so, but let them go, And be you blithe and bonny, Converting all your sounds of woe Into hey nonny nonny.”— Much Ado About Nothing Act 2, scene 3, 62–69

I'm a champion reblogger with a plethora of fandoms to draw from. Occasional rants and ramblings are commonplace. It's not always high brow around here. Questions? Hit up my ask box!

tags: You’d Whine If They Gave You What You Wanted
Either Go See The Movie or Don’t
summary: Captain Marvel and the future of the Avengers, explained
body:
Hey…

Did you know…

There’s an actual storyline or two in the comics where CAPTAIN MARVEL and The Avengers have teamed up?

“In the comic books, Carol and the Avengers have saved the universe on multiple occasions. And in 2015, Carol teamed up with Black Panther and a few other superheroes as the Ultimates, a team tasked with eliminating cosmic threats — basically an outfit seemingly designed in a lab specifically to take on Thanos. So there’s plenty of comics precedent for Carol Danvers facing the sort of situation at the end of Infinity War.”

Did you also remember what huge comic nerds the Russo Brothers are?

Yeah, for those already bitching about the possible plot line of Endgame, you might want to check the source material the Russo’s are working from before throwing a conniption fit in the tags. Just a thought. You might not like it, but it just might be in the comics.

Quotation Credit: https://www.vox.com/2018/5/14/17325708/avengers-infinity-war-captain-marvel-post-credits-larson

Captain Marvel and the future of the Avengers, explained
